para.text: MNW2: Multi-Node Well Package (Version 2) Pane
The
MNW2: Multi-Node Well package
pane is on the
tab of the
dialog box. Each object in which the MNW2 package is active defines one multi-node well.
The
MNW2: Multi-Node Well package
pane has five tabs. Only the tabs that contain options that can be used for the multi-node well that is being edited will be visible.
The
tab contains controls relating to the various options that may be specified for the well.
If the model for well loss is not equal to NONE, the

tab will be visible. On it, the user specifies the data required for the selected loss model. Note that model for well loss is only allowed to be NONE for wells that are only in a single cell. The data on the
tab will not be used if well screens are defined on the
tab.
The MNW2 package allows the pumping rate to decrease as lift increases. To use this option, check the
PUMPCAP
checkbox and the
tab will appear.
The user must specify the pumping rate and other time varying data on the
tab.
If a vertical well has multiple screened intervals, those screened intervals can be specified on the
tab and the data on the
tab will be ignored.

tab will define the location of the well screen (unless well screens are defined on the
tab instead).
Drawing a horizontal multi-node well is also relatively simple; use a line object with a single
drawn on the top view of the model.
